result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Plea/sentencing hearing on November 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.

2:45 PM Defendant Trisha Dee Ann Hiley in court, in custody from Columbia County Jail.  Attorney Claire M Edwards in court for Trisha Dee Ann Hiley.  Prosecuting attorney Jonathan Ross in court for the State of Wisconsin. Right to preliminary hearing recited to defendant. Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over. Attorney Edwards is to see Br. 1 JA for an argued plea/sentencing hearing. Information filed, reading waived. Defendant stood mute. Court entered not guilty plea. Bond remains. 2:48 PM

records.addlTxt: Pretrial 8-2-22 at 9:50 AM and Return date 9/8/22 at 9:00 AM
No possession or consumption of alcoholic beverages. Not operate motor vehicle without a valid license. Standard felony conditions.

10:18 AM Prosecuting attorney Jordan Lippert in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Trisha Dee Ann Hiley in court, in custody. Court recited history of case. Questioned if the charge will remain or be changed to a 5th offense. State confirmed the defendant has been convicted this would now be a 5th or 6th offense. The criminal complaint has been prepared. Court took brief recess to have the complaint filed. 10:23/ 10:41 Case recalled appearances the same. Court also called 22CF340. Defendant waived reading of complaint. Advised of rights. Given SPD information from Clerk. Court set bond at $4500.00 cash. Not operate motor vehicle without a valid license. No possession or consumption of alcoholic beverages. Standard felony conditions. Time limits for the preliminary hearing waived. State will send order to dismiss the 19CT67 case. Court dismissed 19CT67. 10:46 AM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 09:50 am.
Return date scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.
